Adam Jack wrote:

>I'm sorry for what you consider noise. I guess I got involved in the
>discussion, I thought it was (at times) useful. Since it was my first
>posting (and heck, I was throttled by moderation) how was I to know that you
>didn't want discuss on the list.
>
>  
>
...

>I'd like to think I've been thinking, but hmm ... let me think about that
>some more ... Yup, I'm pretty sure I was. You judge so harshly yet you admit
>you deleted much of what was there. Couldn't you have just kept on deleting
>and kept this to yourself? No, I guess you want a quiet mailing list. Ok,
>you win -- I'm done.
>
This is starting to get silly, Adam, you are very thinskinned.  I was 
also a part of those posts.  I took no offense.  Do you look for slights 
and imagined mortal insults?  I'm new here too, it's not my list.  It's 
their list.  If you can't take the criticism, then stop talking about 
leaving and do it.

If I understand correctly, they would like less traffic, perhaps 
infrequent simple questions and relatively small discussions of 
interesting tidbits.  What did occur was a rather boisterous and 
slightly heated discussion between you and JB.   I've jumped off lists 
in the past when I kept getting 20 or thirty emails a day from them.  I 
imagine they don't want to do this.

So take it under advisement, and don't be so sensitive!

>-1 -- but hey, I clearly don't fit here. I thought I was discussing
>something of small potential with the development team of junit, but I
>clearly got that all wrong. I guess from that mistaken hypothesis all
>conclusion is obviously worthless, so I should've just given up when I
>thought about giving up. I learned a lot from these threads, just little of it was about junit & most
>  
>
>of it was about this list's participants.
>
>No more noise from me...
>
>  
>
Cry me a river...

We've all learned plenty about you. You had some good ideas, but please 
toughen up.  We walked into their house.
